answers.answer: You'll down fine just relax nd enjoy your two weeks off they shouldn't have given you breakfast before taking your blood nd they probably gave you something with lots of sugar
They did!! Eggs bacon a Orange coffee and cranberry juice and potatoes lol I'm like really? I just ate lol
the potatoes orange cranberry juice and coffee raised it up really high and they should of known that before giving it too you I got the same thing
Smh that's crazy like they knew what they were doing lol my mom thinks the same thing cuz I always try to eat healthy as much as possible I'm too broke to eat out lol all I crave is fruit and salad
Yeah doctors are stupid You know whata whatI know wouldn't listen if I were you.
Yea I don't want too but my mom insist I go. Even tho it's a waste of time which I will tell the doctors Friday. Now I'm being watched Like a hawk because they think my sugar is too high

It shouldn't be that high ever, unless you have GD or diabetes before pregnancy. I have diabetes diagnosed before pregnancy and my numbers are never that high and I could eat a whole cake. Take it easy and follow orders mama. As for telling you your baby might die, that's a little crazy. However you could be passing on your diabetes to your LO, or they could gain too much weight causing labor and delivery complications. Goodluck and take your two weeks of bedrest to monitor carefully and relax.

I am 31 weeks I had to start checking mine 5 times a day because I failed the glucose test. Your sugar isn't suppose to be over 120 after two hours of eating a meal. Mine hasn't been over 120 at all since I started checking it. Try to cut out anything high in sugar and carbs. It will help keep your sugar from rising. Bread is really bad for you.

I didn't even go for GD yet I can get it back down easily. I have a drs appt tomorrow with the GD doctor. But I wouldn't do that to my baby ever I try to be so careful. Doesn't stress raise blood sugar? Or is that blood pressure? Cuz I have been stressed out lately. But I'm going to do what's Best for my son he's my first!!

I'm getting tested for diabetes in three weeks my doctor gave me the sugar drink to drink an hour before my appointment and they made it clear to not eat or drink anything sweet before it!! I'm sorry you have to go through this

That's funny because my ob said I can eat before but I'm not lol they lie so bad!! I will get through it 3 more months and I don't have to deal with it. Cuz after he comes I will be healthy and working out when I heal I want to be healthy for my child and set a good example

question: So I came from the hospital yesterday and they said my sugar was high...well duh because you fed me breakfast before you pricked my finger!! It was 274 after breakfast and then maybe 2 hours not even it went to 229 now I have to go see a dietician and have to check every day which is not fair. Cuz last week when They took my blood they never said anything. I hate doctors sometimes. He said if I don't cut back my child Will most likely die or he won't be able to move his arm cuz his shoulders won't fit coming out. But everyone said he's right on time he weighs what he's suppose too I don't eat bad because I didn't want gd and deal with this. I walk on the trail twice a week it's just frustrating how they just do stuff like this. I can get my sugar down no problem it's just why say something now I'm in my last 3 months....and no work for 2 weeks? That's a little overboard but it's what's best for my son so I have to do it. I need guidance ladies!!!
title: third trimester today!!! :) but on bed rest for 2 weeks :(
